comments.body: It's not possible that multiple values are in str(options), is that right? If so, can break when found.
We have command, display_value, and arg; is it not easier to build the desired result directly rather than inserting a sentinel value and replacing?

I did this previously, but the code was less readable in my opinion - I think the current format is more compact and readable.
I'll have a think..
there is a purpose this is structured why it is for the follow-on converting to LaTeX from CSS. I think we can leave this as is for now and re-assess afterwards.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1130,1134 @@            if arg in str(options):
                display_value = formatter[arg].replace(
                    "--to_parse", _parse_latex_options_strip(value=options, arg=arg)
                )
                break  # only ever one purposeful entry
